item.title: Dolly Parton responds to concerns about her health, says she is not dying
item.description: Dolly Parton has taken to social media to hose down speculation about her health after a comment from her sister sent fans into a tailspin.

item.title: Sam Kerr returns to Champions League in Chelsea's draw with Twente Enschede
item.description: Australian striker Sam Kerr makes another appearance for Chelsea off the bench, getting 23 minutes of playing time but unable to break a 1-1 deadlock with their Dutch opponent.

item.title: Israel and Hamas agree to first phase of peace plan, Donald Trump says
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Israel and the militant group Hamas have accepted the first phase of a peace plan.

item.title: Gaza updates: Israelis and Palestinians celebrate agreement on first phase of peace proposal — as it happened
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Israel and the militant group Hamas have signed off on the first phase of a Gaza peace proposal that would see a pause in fighting and the release of at least some hostages and prisoners.

item.title: Argentina-Puerto Rico football friendly moved from Chicago amid immigration crack down
item.description: An Argentine Football Association executive confirms an upcoming football match against Puerto Rico is moving from Chicago due to the National Guard being called in to quell immigration protests.

item.title: Mount Gambier's Urgent Care Clinic to reopen but GP shortage continues
item.description: While a government-funded medical clinic is set to reopen, residents in SA's second biggest city are still struggling to access local care.

item.title: RFS firefighter seriously injured by falling tree at Coutts Crossing
item.description: A volunteer firefighter is hospitalised with head and neck injuries after being hit by a falling tree on a fireground on the NSW north coast.

item.title: Fertiliser plant uncertainty puts Mount Isa Copper Smelter future in doubt despite bailout
item.description: Mining giant Glencore's government bailout was touted as its outback smelter's saving grace, but uncertainty about a fertiliser plant it relies on could still see it cease production before 2028.

item.title: Albany's tiny art gallery joins growing global community
item.description: A new tiny art gallery on WA's south coast adds to a growing global movement of community verge-side offerings that range from puzzles to seed exchange.

item.title: Victorian government defends bail laws as opposition criticises new judicial guidance
item.description: The Victorian government defends the strength of its bail laws, after the opposition criticised a recently updated guide instructing bail decision-makers to release an alleged child offender "whenever possible".

item.title: The draft order to approve Hobart's stadium has been released. So what's in it?
item.description: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

item.title: Madeleine McCann's mother tells court she is distressed by stalker who claims to be her daughter
item.description: The mother of Madeleine McCann says a woman accused of stalking her for over two years made her feel distressed and "invaded" by approaching her at her house and claiming to be her daughter. Madeleine went missing in 2007, aged three.

item.title: Victorian Liberal MP Wendy Lovell makes mass citizenship email mistake
item.description: A mass email from a Liberal MP wrongly congratulates many people across northern Victoria on becoming new Australian citizens.

item.title: Hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's case sparks outrage in NT communities as victim's family calls for jail time
item.description: A fatal hit-and-run case in Darwin has exposed deep disparities in the NT’s justice system, say Aboriginal leaders, as the victim’s family speaks out.

item.title: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay charged with grooming teen
item.description: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay has faced the ACT Magistrates Court, charged with grooming a teenage boy.

item.title: Cessnock Rifle Club captain charged with manslaughter after pig hunting incident
item.description: A 63-year-old rifle club captain has been granted bail after being charged with manslaughter over a shooting incident in the NSW Hunter Valley.

item.title: Israel and Hamas have reached an agreement. What does this mean for the Gaza peace plan?
item.description: All of the living Israeli hostages in Gaza could be released as soon as next week under the first phase of a peace plan led by the United States — but the full details are yet to be released. Here is what we know so far.

item.title: UN to slash quarter of peacekeepers in nine operations globally due to lack of funds
item.description: That would amount to between 13,000 and 14,000 troops and police removed from their nine operations around the world.

item.title: Man charged with careless driving over fatal crash involving CBH grain train near Albany
item.description: The man behind the wheel of a car that collided with a freight train near Albany, killing his female passenger, has been charged with careless driving.

item.title: Former RAAF pilot Robert John Crawford to stand trial over alleged murder of wife, Frances Crawford
item.description: Robert John Crawford has pleaded not guilty to the murder of his wife Frances Crawford, who was found dead at the couple's home last year.

item.title: Pat Cummins's injury recovery continues ahead of Ashes, Mitchell Starc confident he can perform
item.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins is in serious doubt for the Ashes and has almost been ruled out of appearing in the first Test as he continues his recovery from a back injury.

item.title: Denmark to ban social media for under 15s, following Australia's world-leading laws
item.description: Denmark is planning to ban children under 15 from using social media, following Australia's world-first laws to curb social media use among teenagers.

item.title: Gaza emergency doctor evacuated, reunites with husband Dr Mo in Perth
item.description: Mohammed Mustafa and Nour Dalloul got married while bombs exploded around them. Now their war-torn love, forged in the emergency rooms of a Gazan hospital, has found a home in Australia.

item.title: Bell Bay Aluminium delivers 'unsettling news' to staff ahead of power deal expiry
item.description: Bell Bay Aluminium has told staff the company faces a "significant risk" after negotiations for a new power deal stalled, jeopardising its future.

item.title: How reading romance has helped keep the spark alive for this couple
item.description: After 10 years of marriage and two kids, Joseph Heath and wife Laura are still in the "honeymoon phase". He says romance novels are a large part of why.

item.title: Man charged over alleged death threat against Prime Minister Anthony Albanese refused bail
item.description: A Queensland man accused of threatening to kill the prime minister has been refused bail, with a magistrate describing his alleged threats as "deeply disturbing."

item.title: Tony Burke suddenly keen to answer questions about Islamic State relatives
item.description: This week in Canberra, Tony Burke finally answered questions about the return of Islamic State relatives, Senate estimates turned into an episode of Utopia, and Andrew Hastie quit the frontbench.

item.title: Former transport official Ibrahim Helmy tells corruption watchdog he artificially inflated invoices
item.description: Former NSW transport official Ibrahim Helmy tells the corruption watchdog he artificially inflated invoices for work provided to the government before splitting the profits with contractors.

item.title: Tasmanians urged to prepare for wind gusts of up to 125kph
item.description: Residents on the north and west coast of Tasmania are being warned to secure loose items around their homes ahead of wind gusts of up to 125 kilometres per hour.

item.title: Kangaroo Island visitor details 'extraordinary moment of timing' family came across shark attack
item.description: A man who witnessed the "extraordinary" moment a surfer was bitten by a shark chasing a seal offshore Kangaroo Island has spoken to the ABC after his footage circulated online.

item.title: First look inside the Sydney Fish Market, with opening date yet to be confirmed
item.description: The NSW government is expecting construction for the long-awaited Sydney Fish Market development to be completed by next month, but an opening date for the $700 million project is yet to be announced.

item.title: Israel and Hamas's first-phase peace plan agreement is monumental but the end of the war is far from certain
item.description: The announcement that Israel and Hamas have agreed to phase one of a peace deal in Gaza is significant. But despite the celebrations, the end of the war is still far from certain, writes Matthew Doran.

item.title: Netball fights for recognition amid influx of women's sports
item.description: Netball Australia is taking elite-level netball to regional communities, hoping to showcase the sport's global impact and inspire the next generation of athletes.

item.title: How drought inspired Goondiwindi's thriving art movement
item.description: Goondiwindi's Lanescape art collective transforms the Queensland border town into an open-air gallery featuring large steel sculptures.

item.title: Israelis celebrate deal announcement with US flags and Trump costume
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mitch Brown was thrust into the spotlight after coming out. He wants to use it to 'call people in,' not out
item.description: After coming out, Mitch Brown became an unofficial spokesperson for queer issues in the AFL. While that experience has been overwhelmingly positive, it's also come with an onslaught of hate.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne boosts Ashes hopes with One-Day Cup century for Queensland
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne's case for a men's Ashes call-up continues to build after he scored a second century in the space of a week and third of the domestic summer.

item.title: Future of pokies boss hangs in balance after US gaming licence troubles
item.description: An Australian pokie machine giant says it is reviewing its chief executive's future after a US gaming regulator spurned his licence application. It comes months after the ABC revealed he was the subject of a corruption investigation in Austria.

item.title: Competition watchdog approves Elders' $475m acquisition of agribusiness rival Delta
item.description: The consumer watchdog has given the go-ahead for Elders to acquire its competitor, Delta, but it must sell six Delta stores in WA to improve competition.

item.title: Family 'quite nasty' to woman who married step-uncle before his alleged murder, court hears
item.description: A woman who married her step-uncle under Islamic law — before he was allegedly murdered by her brother at his Brisbane home — has told a court her family accused her of committing incest.

item.title: Melbourne Storm grants Nelson Asofa-Solomona immediate release from NRL contract
item.description: Melbourne will clear Nelson Asofa-Solomona's salary from its cap after the powerful front-rower was granted a release from the final two years of his deal with the club.

item.title: Teenager denied bail after allegedly posting Islamic State propaganda and threatening synagogue
item.description: A teenager who allegedly posted terrorism propaganda online and made threats to kill has been denied bail.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bunbury massage therapist Anthony Brain sex assault trial begins with French nudist colony claims
item.description: Bunbury masseur Anthony Brain told women clients he needed to work on intimate parts of their bodies to relieve tension, but in reality it was for his own pleasure, a Perth court hears as his sexual assault trial gets underway.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Ahmad Hodroj handed five-year jail term for domestic violence manslaughter of Amira Moughnieh
item.description: Amira Moughnieh's estranged husband will be released from prison in 2026 after being sentenced to five years' jail for her manslaughter on Thursday.

item.title: Ruby Hunter, Shellie Morris and Missy Higgins among recipients at Australian Women in Music Awards
item.description: The Australian Women in Music Awards recognised contributions across the music sector, from artists, to photographers, journalists, filmmakers, and leaders.

item.title: Europe Commission President Ursula von der Leyen survives no-confidence votes
item.description: The European Commission president has faced criticism from the left and right after striking a tariff deal with the United States.

item.title: China further limits the export of rare earth materials and products
item.description: The issue has been a key sticking point in the trade war between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: Jail term increased for man who appealed Gisele Pelicot rape conviction
item.description: Husamettin Dogan, 44, was the only one to have maintained his appeal after the first trial last year of 51 men, including Gisele Pelicot's husband, in the case of mass sexual abuse that shocked France and the world.

item.title: Google is abruptly changing the game for journalism — again
item.description: The launch of 'AI Mode' ushers in a future where news sites are kept alive to train AI chatbots for a US tech company.

item.title: Gaza updates: US sending 200 troops to Israel to help monitor peace deal — as it happened
item.description: The Israeli cabinet has approved a framework for the release of hostages, according to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Vladimir Putin is fearful the return of his convict army could destabilise Russian society, sources say
item.description: The Russian president views the prospect of an army returning en masse as a potential risk he wants carefully managed to avoid destabilising society, three sources close to the Kremlin said.

item.title: First Guardian super trustee Diversa 'ticked off' investments, says former financial adviser Ferras Merhi
item.description: A former financial adviser involved in placing thousands of clients into the First Guardian Master Fund says he was given clearance by superannuation trustee Diversa to do so after the trustee initially flagged compliance concerns.

item.title: Ceasefire announcement met with joy and some scepticism in Israel and Gaza
item.description: The announcement of an agreement to phase one of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas brings great joy to many people in Israel and Gaza.

item.title: Sick sea turtle rescued from algal bloom recovering at Adelaide Zoo
item.description: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

item.title: Will the Liberals hold firm in the fight over freedom of information?
item.description: Crossbenchers are joining forces to condemn the government's FOI bill, calling for its withdrawal and an independent inquiry. Will the Coalition stand for transparency?

item.title: The US sees Pacific Islands as 'tip of the spear', but locals fear becoming China's 'bullseye'
item.description: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

item.title: Coal-fired power stations to operate in Queensland until least 2046 as energy road map unveiled
item.description: The five-year plan lays out what role coal, gas, wind, solar, pumped hydro and battery storage will play over the long-term in Queensland.

item.title: Beyond Blue survey finds loneliness has deeper impact on some Australians' mental health than financial hardship
item.description: A new national report by Beyond Blue has revealed loneliness and social isolation has reached new heights, with 46 per cent of respondents listing it as a bigger mental health stressor than financial hardship.

item.title: Why Alliyah is identifying themselves as a victim-survivor — and the power this act holds
item.description: Alliyah's decision to talk about their abuse was a brave act that exposed the red flags that weren't caught along the way — and they hope it helps others.

item.title: Inside the NSW government chat group as the Sydney Harbour Bridge pro-Palestinian march unfolded
item.description: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal internal discussions within the NSW government did not align with the external NSW Police messaging that the march could have been "catastrophic".

item.title: Advocates mixed on plans to bolster undercover police powers to share child abuse material
item.description: The spread of child abuse material in Australia has come under renewed focus following high-profile incidents of childcare workers abusing toddlers, and a push by the Coalition to introduce mandatory minimum prison sentences for child exploitation offences.

item.title: Global pilot shortage could mean more delays after push to raise retirement age
item.description: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

item.title: London is the world's 'phone theft capital', but one Aussie decides to fight back
item.description: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.

item.title: Man returns to boxing after sepsis forces partial amputations of his arms and legs
item.description: Adam Smith became "fixated" on returning to the gym after sepsis forced the partial amputation of his arms and legs. Now he can press 365 kilograms and get back into boxing.

item.title: Boy, 16, among three alleged 'contract criminals' charged in Sydney 'kill car' blitz
item.description: Strike Force Flodine is investigating a network of alleged "contract criminals" hired by organised crime groups, and their use of staged vehicles or "kill cars" in Sydney.

item.title: South Africa defeat India by three wickets in Women's Cricket World Cup at Visakhapatnam
item.description: South Africa defeats co-hosts India by three wickets in the group stage of the Women's Cricket World Cup.

item.title: New statistics show Victoria's most dangerous roads are in regional areas
item.description: In regional Victoria, potholes are not being fixed and major rural road projects have stalled, despite the loss of life from accidents.

item.title: The NT's first Alice Springs-based police commissioner has a rocky road ahead
item.description: Martin Dole has been a Northern Territory police officer for nearly 30 years — but as the new commissioner, his most challenging role now lies ahead.

item.title: Two dead on private property in Tasmania after tree falls in wild winds
item.description: Two people have died after a tree fell on them on a rural property in Tasmania's north-west, during Friday's severe winds and wet weather, police say.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock fronts Senate hearing, ASX ends the week lower — As it happened
item.description: Michele Bullock says either shoppers or merchants will have to pay more under the central bank's proposed debit and credit card changes. The ASX closed lower after oil and gold prices retreated.

item.title: Rain causes crashes during first Bathurst 1000 practice sessions on Mount Panorama
item.description: Supercars heavyweights Triple Eight lead the charge into the Bathurst 1000 with one eye on the trophy and another on the weather forecast.

item.title: What the State of WA’s appeal of Dion Barber’s $2.8 million compensation win could mean for abuse survivors
item.description: Less than a decade after the door opened for victims of historic child sexual abuse to seek justice in WA, abuse survivors could be at risk of having that door shut again, writes Cason Ho.

item.title: Hamas is trusting Trump as his 'eternal peace' in Gaza turns into a shaky ceasefire
item.description: With Israel and Hamas not sticking to Donald Trump's proposed "20-point plan", the deal to bring "eternal peace" in the Middle East looks more like a temporary ceasefire.

item.title: Letitia James, NY attorney general and Donald Trump foe, indicted for bank fraud
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of US President Donald Trump, is indicted for bank fraud.

item.title: AFL trade period, day five recap: Geelong opens Charlie Curnow bidding as Sydney looms, Ben Ainsworth and Campbell Chesser join Blues
item.description: The chase for Carlton star Charlie Curnow heated up on day five of the AFL trade period, with Geelong seeing an offer rejected as Sydney prepared its bid.

item.title: Novak Djokovic advances to Shanghai Masters semifinals, qualifier Valentin Vacherot continues fairytale run
item.description: Fourth seed Novak Djokovic battled past a spirited Zizou Bergs 6-3 7-5 on Thursday to reach the Shanghai Masters semifinals for a 10th time, setting up a clash with surprise package and world number 204 Valentin Vacherot.

item.title: Indonesia urges respect for its sovereignty after Australia-PNG defence treaty
item.description: The landmark agreement commits both countries to "meet the common danger" in the event of an armed attack on either. With that, questions have been raised about Australia's role if the conflict in West Papua escalates.

item.title: When is the Nobel Peace Prize awarded? Who decides the winner?
item.description: As we wait for the announcement tonight, let's unpack how the awards work.

item.title: What NSW court ruling on Sydney Opera House pro-Palestinian march means for future protests
item.description: The state's three top judges have ruled to block a pro-Palestinian march at the Sydney Opera House this weekend, but experts say an element of their decision sets a precedent that could have major implications on protests going forward.

item.title: Israeli government approves phase one of Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal
item.description: The Israeli government has approved Gaza's ceasefire and hostage deal, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said early on Friday.

item.title: Australia's dark matter experiment construction nears completion
item.description: Deep underground in an old gold mine in regional Victoria, scientists enter a worldwide race to understand the composition of dark matter.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Industrial businesses to ramp-up noise monitoring over humming noise in Sydney's north-west
item.description: The NSW environmental watchdog has acted on complaints by residents in Sydney's north-west who have been kept awake at night by a disturbing humming noise.

item.title: Several Australian Gaza flotilla activists home after being detained by Israel
item.description: Australians who were on the Global Sumud Flotilla, a fleet of ships intercepted by Israel's navy off Gaza last week, are met by supporters upon their arrival.

item.title: Principals' power to ban aggressive parents from school grounds to extend to social media behaviour
item.description: Principals in Victoria already have the power to ban aggressive or violent parents from school grounds, but the state government is looking to apply the power to parents' behaviour on social media.

item.title: Federal government investigates PFAS spread in Rockhampton amid concern for property prices
item.description: Christine Stasch was planning to sell her family farm and retire further north. Now, she is fighting for compensation after discovering PFAS contamination on her property.

item.title: David McBride's last-ditch attempt to overturn conviction thrown out by High Court
item.description: The former military lawyer was sentenced to five years and eight months in jail after sharing classified material with journalists in a case that has raised debate about whistleblower laws.

item.title: Hollywood icon Paul Feig to take audiences behind-the-scenes of Bridesmaids at SXSW Sydney
item.description: Hollywood director Paul Feig has a special strategy that's served him well when it comes to making popular movies and television shows that stand the test of time.

item.title: Synergy apologises after overcharging customers $40 million
item.description: More than 170,000 customers have been overcharged a total of $40 million by WA's state-owned energy retailer Synergy since 2009, sparking an apology from its CEO.

item.title: Princess Kate warns screen time feeds 'epidemic of disconnection' that threatens child development
item.description: In a joint essay with a Harvard Medical School professor, Princess Kate says the young generation may be the most digitally connected but is "simultaneously being more isolated".

item.title: Public health alert for nitazenes issued after person dies in Queensland
item.description: Queensland Health issues a public health alert warning nitazenes have been detected in tablets.

item.title: Cairns faces prospect of water restrictions at wettest time of year
item.description: Cairns residents are urged to cut down on their water use as multiple infrastructure failures put the city at risk of water shortfalls heading into summer.

item.title: PM says there's 'nothing unusual' in Treasury meeting on contentious superannuation tax proposal
item.description: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

item.title: Matildas confirm return of Sam Kerr to squad for England and Wales friendlies
item.description: Sam Kerr is back in the Matildas squad for the first time since late 2023, ahead of friendlies against Wales and England.

item.title: Judge dismisses Drake's lawsuit over Kendrick Lamar diss track Not Like Us
item.description: The judge says a reasonable listener could not have concluded that Not Like Us was conveying objective facts about Drake.

item.title: Working dog makes championship comeback after leg amputation
item.description: Cheese was on track to be a champion when an accident cut his working dog trial career short. A year on from a leg amputation, the border collie is back in the yards and the winner's circle.

item.title: Two dead after magnitude-7.4 Philippines earthquake sparks tsunami warnings
item.description: The quake hit in the Mindanao region at a depth of 62 kilometres below ground level and could cause hazardous tsunami waves along coasts within 300km of the epicentre, seismology authorities say.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock says First Home Guarantee could lead to riskier loans
item.description: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says the federal government's First Home Guarantee scheme could see some Australians taking out riskier loans.

item.title: David Pocock reinvited to parliament sports club after prime minister weighs in
item.description: The former star Wallabies player turned independent senator was kicked out of the social sports club after raising concerns about its links to the gambling industry.

item.title: Victorian fruit grower to stand trial over coolroom death of truck driver
item.description: A fruit-growing company in northern Victoria will stand trial over the death of a 50-year-old man who was found unresponsive in a coolroom in 2023.

item.title: Vladimir Putin says Russian air defences were to blame for Azerbaijani jetliner crash
item.description: The Russian president makes his first public admission of responsibility for the crash, in an effort to improve relations with Azerbaijan.

item.title: Australia 'still optimistic' Pat Cummins will play first Ashes Test against England
item.description: With the opening men's Ashes Test six weeks away, Australia coach Andrew McDonald is not willing to rule out Pat Cummins taking the field in Perth.

item.title: Patients may not see benefits of $8.5 billlion bulk-billing boost for four years
item.description: Patients may not see the benefits of higher bulk-billing for years, and average-out-of-pocket costs are expected to rise, the health department has conceded — despite $8.5 billion being tipped into the GP subsidy scheme from November.

item.title: Sydney rock oysters to be grown at Lakes Entrance on the Gippsland Lakes
item.description: Victoria could have its own Sydney rock oyster industry after a trial in the state's east yielded positive results.

item.title: Can you ever throw out a previous home owner or renter's mail?
item.description: Even years after moving in, you might still be receiving someone else’s bills and letters. Here’s what can you do about it.

item.title: Teens charged with murder after deaths of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek refuse to attend court
item.description: Two teenagers charged with murder after the deaths of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek have refused to board the prison van to attend court.

item.title: Donna Nelson drops attempts to overturn Japan drug smuggling conviction
item.description: A Perth grandmother duped into becoming a drug mule in an elaborate love scam abandons her final line of appeal on drug importing charges in Japan.

item.title: David Sharaz served bankruptcy papers by former WA Senator Linda Reynolds after defamation win
item.description: Brittany Higgins's husband David Sharaz is served bankruptcy papers by former Senator Linda Reynolds, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her by a Perth court for defamation.

item.title: Former Olympic basketballer Danny Morseu 'disappointed' retrial abandoned
item.description: Danny Morseu's conviction has been wiped but he says he will struggle to find a job, a home, and a source of income after Queensland's Director of Public Prosecutions decided not to pursue a retrial.

item.title: More Indian cough syrups recalled after 19 children die by poisoning
item.description: The World Health Organisation flags the risk of unregulated export of poisoned Indian cough syrup after 19 deaths.

item.title: LIV's financial losses do not deter SA premier from $50m golf course
item.description: Premier Peter Malinauskas has rejected suggestions his government's North Adelaide golf course redevelopment is a risky investment with LIV Golf losing hundreds of millions a year, as he revealed where the Saudi-backed tournament will be hosted in 2027.

item.title: Court throws out man's attempt to charge government officials using archaic practice
item.description: A Port Augusta resident's attempt to charge several government officials and his local council with more than 350 criminal offences using an archaic concept of common law is tossed out by court.

item.title: Socceroos wary of Canada ahead of international friendly in Montreal
item.description: In the build-up to Saturday's match in Montreal, Socceroos coach Tony Popovic feels Canada has given his squad the ultimate compliment.

item.title: State government urged to reject Comiskey Group's Coochin Fields music festival site
item.description: A coalition of Sunshine Coast community groups is calling on the state government to scrap a major music festival development because of ecological concerns raised by the State Assessment and Referrals Agency.

item.title: Australians travelling to Europe warned of long delays at airports after new entry rules
item.description: Facial scans and fingerprinting will replace passport stamps across 29 countries in the Schengen Zone from October 12.

item.title: Brodie Kostecki sets qualifying record to snare Bathurst 1000 provisional pole
item.description: Brodie Kostecki looks a strong chance to become the third driver to claim three consecutive Bathurst 1000 poles after going fastest in Friday's qualifying session.

item.title: Protecting rock art from wasp nests in Central Australia's Trephina Gorge with chopsticks and brushes
item.description: Rock art has significant cultural importance to traditional owners, and is a highlight for visitors who make the hike to see it. These Ltyentye Apurte Rangers are working to help keep them protected from wasp nests.

item.title: Hoop pine may set record as Australia's tallest rainforest tree
item.description: Researchers mapping millions of trees as part of a climate change study think they have found Australia's tallest rainforest tree.

item.title: Coalition frontbencher tries to reframe immigration policy debate
item.description: Shadow Immigration Minister Paul Scarr has called for a "measured and considered" debate over migration levels after incendiary comments by members of the party's right flank.

item.title: Japan's ruling coalition splits, throwing Takaichi's PM bid into doubt
item.description: Japan's Komeito party on Friday said it would quit its coalition with the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP). Its departure could trigger an unwinding of the so-called "Takaichi trade", which had been driven by investor optimism around fiscal stimulus.

item.title: SA government 'cautiously optimistic' about toxic algal bloom
item.description: SA government officials say there are some positive signs around the toxic algal bloom crisis as it continues to affect the state's metropolitan beaches.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado awarded Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: The Venezuelan opposition leader is awarded the prize for "her tireless work promoting democratic rights" in the country.

item.title: Ceasefire begins but IDF to remain in Gaza Strip until Hamas disarms, Netanyahu says
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces announces a ceasefire has begun, but Benjamin Netanyahu says Israeli forces will remain in Gaza to pressure Hamas until it disarms.

item.title: Japan's decorated trucks facing extinction
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Experts say Donald Trump had 'no chance' of receiving Nobel Peace Price
item.description: Donald Trump has not been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize. Despite his persistent claim that he "deserves" it, experts are not at all surprised he is not the recipient.

item.title: Western Bulldogs extend Essendon's losing streak with 57 point thrashing
item.description: The Western Bulldogs have kept their faint AFLW finals hopes alive with a commanding 57 point drubbing of Essendon.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: International Criminal Court rejects Rodrigo Duterte's bid for release from detention
item.description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte must remain behind bars while awaiting trial, judges at the ICC have ruled, saying he might use his freedom to interfere with the legal process and suggesting he was a flight risk.

item.title: Melania Trump has 'open' line of communication with Vladimir Putin on Ukrainian children
item.description: The US first lady tells reporters at the White House that eight children have been reunited with their families in the last 24 hours.

item.title: Liberals find brief lull in internal hostilities for a passable week
item.description: If there was some internal call within the Liberals to show some discipline after the last few weeks, it worked at a basic level.

item.title: Donald Trump to impose new 100 per cent tariffs on China after Beijing restricts rare earths
item.description: The US President takes to Truth Social to say he sees "no reason" to meet Xi Jinping after Beijing's "hostile" move to restrict rare-earth exports.

item.title: Memories from the rubble
item.description: When 25-year-old Nour imagines herself back home in Gaza City, she remembers the things that made her smile. Now that's all gone.

item.title: Older borrowers taking out later-in-life loans risk post-retirement mortgage pain
item.description: Property analysts, brokers and banks report more borrowers are taking on big housing debts in their late 40s and 50s and, potentially, a retirement still saddled with mortgage repayments.

item.title: Japan's decorated trucks face 'extinction' but fans and truckies are trying to bring them back
item.description: The dekotora, large decorated trucks covered in colour and bright lights, were once a common sight across Japan. Now they are fighting for survival.

item.title: Las Vegas licence hearing turns nightmare for boss of Australian pokies giant
item.description: Regulators in the world's most influential gaming jurisdiction have dismissed a licence bid by the boss of Australia's Ainsworth Game Technology, branding him "arrogant", "misleading" and lacking in "emotional intelligence".

item.title: Queensland plan to extend life of coal-fired power stations sends 'mixed messages'
item.description: Communities across Queensland have welcomed plans to keep coal and gas burning across the state, though some warn a lack of future planning could undermine short-term benefits.

item.title: Donald Trump deserves credit for stopping the war on Gaza, but his key claim is overblown
item.description: In the tragic arc of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Donald Trump may have closed the latest — and most violent — chapter.

item.title: Gaza updates live: UN agencies still waiting for details on aid rollout for 'critical' relief as ceasefire takes effect
item.description: Displaced for the past two years, Palestinians begin returning to their destroyed homes in Gaza as the Israel-Hamas war ceasefire takes effect.

item.title: Queensland heating up with weekend thunderstorms forecast
item.description: The weather bureau says much of the state can expect above average temperatures with possibly severe thunderstorms in the south-east today.

item.title: Chaotic weather outlook raises prospects of summer bushfires across eastern states
item.description: An atmospheric "tug of war" for control of Australia's weather is taking place this spring, and it is a forecasting nightmare.

item.title: Palestinians stream north and hostage families wait anxiously as Gaza ceasefire begins
item.description: Thousands of Palestinians sheltering in southern Gaza rush to the north, hopeful the ceasefire will hold long enough for them to return home.

item.title: Timor-Leste workers part of PALM scheme helping to fill NT workforce gaps
item.description: The Northern Territory struggles to find workers for low- and semi-skilled jobs, but with increasing numbers of foreign workers arriving under the Pacific Australia Labour Mobility (PALM) scheme, that may be changing.

item.title: Alameddine crime network suspected in murder of UFC fighter Suman Mokhtarian
item.description: Police had intelligence that Sydney's Alameddine organised crime network wanted a former UFC fighter dead more than 18 months before his shooting murder this week.

item.title: AI-generated images of missing 4yo Gus raise legal concerns about misinformation
item.description: The thought of a missing boy lost in the outback is indescribably harrowing — but what's almost as disturbing is the realisation that some on social media have seized on the disappearance of four-year-old Gus as an opportunity to spread misinformation.

item.title: Alex de Minaur loses 6-4, 6-4 to Daniil Medvedev in Shanghai quarterfinals to miss out on career milestone
item.description: Alex de Minaur is eliminated from the Shanghai Masters, going down 6-4, 6-4 to former world number one Danil Medvedev in the quarterfinals, denying the 26-year-old Australian a chance of his 300th tour win.

item.title: The Australian Championship a second chance for 'heartbeat' of football
item.description: The new second division for Australian football has been dubbed a second chance for some of the country's oldest clubs, which hope it will usher in a new era for the game.

item.title: Rockbank man charged with murder over the death of woman at Epping
item.description: A 50-year-old man faces court charged with murder after the death of a 44-year-old woman in Epping on Thursday night.

item.title: Concord Hospital's Ebola practice run-through tests department's emergency response plans
item.description: A high-stakes mission was undertaken at Concord Hospital this week — an exercise to test how multiple government agencies would react to any future infectious diseases outbreak.

item.title: Fashion's misogyny problem might end up in your wardrobe
item.description: Men sit at the top of the world's fashion houses while women designers get torn apart online.

item.title: Derek Gee facing $54 million damages claim after moving from Israel-Premier Tech due to 'safety and personal belief'
item.description: Canadian cyclist Derek Gee terminates his contract with Israel-Premier Tech due to a "safety and personal-belief" standpoint, but says the team is seeking damages worth 30 million Euros ($54 million) as a result.

item.title: Indigenous elder Alby Clarke remembered for ultramarathon and cycling feats
item.description: An Indigenous elder well-known for his sporting achievements, including using long-distance running and cycling to advocate for Aboriginal reconciliation and health, is remembered by loved ones.

item.title: Lung cancer researchers identify 'breakthrough' patterns predictive of treatment success
item.description: University of Queensland researcher Arutha Kulasinghe studied lung biopsies from the tumours of almost 250 patients with non-small cell lung cancer across Australia, the United States and Europe.

item.title: Escapee Australians became undercover agents in Yugoslavia during World War II
item.description: It started a researcher down a rabbit hole "beyond anything anyone could ever dream up", involving deception, double agents, secret names and plans for a genocide.

item.title: Sydney Fish Market to open doors on January 19 next year as old site enjoys its 'last hurrah' in lead-up to Christmas
item.description: Sydney Fish Market CEO Daniel Jarosch says the new development will be able to "open with a bang" on January 19 next year, even though construction at Blackwattle Bay is set to be completed in mid-November.

item.title: GFG Alliance accused of not meeting Tasmanian loan conditions over manganese ore supply
item.description: Australia's only manganese smelter is at the centre of a dispute, after failing to restart a troubled smelter in Tasmania's north despite being given a $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government.

item.title: Art courier Laurie Burgess grows his collection as he travels Australia delivering to galleries
item.description: Laurie Burgess has dedicated two decades to transporting artwork across the country, and has developed an appreciation and knowledge of the Australian art world few could rival.

item.title: Hotel owner mocks Wollongong Council's palm tree art after renovation refusal
item.description: A Wollongong hotel owner goes to unusual heights to mock a controversial piece of public art and protest against a council decision to knock back a development application.

item.title: Tennessee military munitions plant explosion leaves 19 people missing and feared dead
item.description: The explosion at Accurate Energetic Systems in rural Tennessee on Friday morning is heard from miles away and is described by local law enforcement as "one of the worst" tragedies the area has seen.

item.title: Crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and garlic yoghurt is an easy dinner - ABC News
item.description: This popular vegetarian Lebanese dish with crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and a garlicky tahini yoghurt sauce is ready in 30 minutes.

item.title: Socceroos beat 2026 FIFA World Cup co-hosts Canada 1-0 with Nestory Irankunda scoring only goal in Montreal
item.description: Nestory Irankunda's late strike has given the Socceroos a 1-0 victory over FIFA 2026 World Cup co-hosts Canada in in Montreal.

item.title: Soccer the name of the game in Borroloola, even reigning over Australian Rules Football
item.description: Aussie rules football is life for many in remote NT Aboriginal communities but in Borroloola, barefoot young women and girls dream of following their hero into soccer's A-League.

item.title: Mount Burr Swamp thriving after rehabilitation from farmland
item.description: The Mount Burr Swamp in South Australia is brimming with water, giving conservationists hope its success can be a blueprint for the future.

item.title: Bunbury man Stanley J Clemons sentenced for shooting neighbour's dog
item.description: The Bunbury Magistrates Court hears how Stanley J Clemons shot his neighbour's dog and discarded its body, which still has not been found.

item.title: Two-time world 400m hurdles champion Femke Bol steps up to 800m in 'next challenge'
item.description: Jess Hull once called running the 800m a "fun little side quest". For two-time world champion hurdler Femke Bol though, it's just "the next challenge".

item.title: Watchdog says Synergy not the only energy company overcharging amid $40m bungle
item.description: A $40 million overcharging bungle by WA's largest energy retailer was a result of serious governance failures and other businesses may have also fallen foul according to the state's economic watchdog.

item.title: Machete brawl between groups spills into shopping centre in Melbourne's north
item.description: Investigators say a brawl between two groups armed with machetes spilled into a shopping centre in Broadmeadows on Friday night.

item.title: Sydney FC's Amelia Cassar likened to Matildas World Cup heroes ahead of A-League Women season
item.description: At 17, Amelia Cassar is likened to some of Australia's World Cup heroes, as she embarks on her first season with the Sky Blues in the A-League Women competition.

item.title: Defunct NDIS provider given record $2.2 million penalty after Queensland man fatally hit by car
item.description: Proceedings began against the now-defunct provider following the death of a Queensland participant in 2023. The penalty is the highest civil sanction imposed on an NDIS provider to date.

item.description: WA may traditionally be an AFL state but a club in the Pilbara has been named among the nation's best in another footy code.

item.title: Roaring jet boats to return to Victoria for first time in 15 years
item.description: From tractors to jet boats at Elmore, as Victoria prepares to host Australian series jet boat event in 2026.

item.title: Israel announces list of Palestinian prisoners to be released, but one key name is absent
item.description: Israel's Ministry of Justice provides the names of prisoners it will release in exchange for Israeli hostages, but Hamas says no agreement has been reached.

item.title: Victoria's opposition leader launches fresh shadow cabinet ahead of state election next year
item.description: Opposition leader Brad Battin has brought in Kew MP Jess Wilson as shadow treasurer and promoted three first-term MPs.

item.title: Genomic medicine researchers work to fix 'European bias' in DNA databases
